header.name: chaos/preprocessor/control/variadic_if.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a macro that acts as an "if-else" construct.

macro.abstract: The macro expands to one of two alternatives depending on its first argument.

usage.param: The condition that determines whether the macro expands to the first or second __VA_ARGS__. Valid values range from 0 to .
The resulting expression if bit is non-zero. This is the first of the two __VA_ARGS__ in the syntax.
The resulting expression if bit is 0. This is the second of the two __VA_ARGS__ in the syntax.

macro.para: If cond expands to 0, this macro expands to the second __VA_ARGS__. Otherwise, it expands to the first __VA_ARGS__.
This macro performs a Boolean conversion on cond. If this conversion is undesirable, may be used instead.
This macro is lazy. If cond is non-zero, only the first __VA_ARGS__ is evaluated. Likewise, if bit is 0, only the second __VA_ARGS__ is evaluated.

This macro is similar to except that it allows variadic content in its true branch at the cost of preventing expansion of a function-like macros resulting from that branch.
#define A() 1 #define B() 2
(1)(A, B)() // A() (0)(A, B)() // 2
